dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, so uh, big news coming out of the tech world, especially for government contracts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, so uh, big news coming out of the tech world, especially for government contracts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, you mean that JEDI contract drama? I thought that was, like, settled ages ago.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, you mean that J E D I contract drama? I thought that was, like, settled ages ago.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, sorta. Remember how Amazon was really fighting Microsoft's win?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, sorta. Remember how Amazon was really fighting Microsoft's win?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, they were pretty vocal about it, claiming some presidential influence, if I recall.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, they were pretty vocal about it, claiming some presidential influence, if I recall.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But get this: they've totally reversed course.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But get this: they've totally reversed course.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon on Monday escalated its fierce opposition to Microsoft winning a lucrative government contract by calling for testimony from the president and Defense Secretary Mark Esper, according to court documents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? So they're just... dropping it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? So they're just... dropping it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, Monday, Amazon officially applauded Microsoft's win. No more, uh, presidential testimony requests.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, Monday, Amazon officially applauded Microsoft's win. No more, uh, presidential testimony requests.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon on Monday escalated its fierce opposition to Microsoft winning a lucrative government contract by calling for testimony from the president and Defense Secretary Mark Esper, according to court documents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: You're kidding! No more depositions from Trump or Mattis? Or even Esper?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You're kidding! No more depositions from Trump or Mattis? Or even Esper?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. And they're not even asking for discovery anymore. No emails, no documents. Just... done.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. And they're not even asking for discovery anymore. No emails, no documents. Just... done.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon is also asking for court-ordered discovery, meaning the company wants the Trump administration to hand over documents and emails relating to the contract.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's a complete 180. I mean, they were so gung-ho about proving it was, like, politically motivated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's a complete one hundred eighty. I mean, they were so gung-ho about proving it was, like, politically motivated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Their AWS division, you know, Amazon Web Services, was really pushing this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Their A W S division, you know, Amazon Web Services, was really pushing this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a filing with the U.S. Court of Federal Claims, Amazon Web Services asked a judge to allow depositions from Trump, Esper, former Defense Secretary Jim Mattis and Defense Department Chief Information Officer Dana Deasy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what changed, do you think? It's a ten billion dollar contract!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what changed, do you think? It's a ten billion dollar contract!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon claims it lost the $10 billion contract because Trump is personally biased against CEO Jeff Bezos for his ownership of the Washington Post, which Trump claims publishes unfair and negative coverage about him.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good question! The article mentions their previous claims were all about Trump's personal agenda, you know, with Bezos and the Washington Post.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good question! The article mentions their previous claims were all about Trump's personal agenda, you know, with Bezos and the Washington Post.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon claims it lost the $10 billion contract because Trump is personally biased against CEO Jeff Bezos for his ownership of the Washington Post... President Trump has repeatedly demonstrated his willingness to use his position as President and Commander in Chief to interfere with government functions—including federal procurement—to advance his personal agenda, an AWS spokesperson said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The filing cites Trumps tweets attacking Bezos, including one calling him Jeff Bozo, and a passage from an October 2019 book by Mattiss speechwriter, who wrote that Trump said he wanted to screw Amazon out of the contract, as evidence of the presidents intent and hostility toward Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but now they're just... saying they're satisfied. It's a huge shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but now they're just... saying they're satisfied. It's a huge shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon on Monday escalated its fierce opposition to Microsoft winning a lucrative government contract by calling for testimony from the president and Defense Secretary Mark Esper, according to court documents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's like, they had this whole legal battle ready to go, and then poof.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's like, they had this whole legal battle ready to go, and then poof.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, no more drama then. Just Microsoft gets the contract, and Amazon just, uh, shakes hands?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, no more drama then. Just Microsoft gets the contract, and Amazon just, uh, shakes hands?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. Quite the twist, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. Quite the twist, huh?
